Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2009 07:30PM TJW wrote: Everyminute, I have the same problem.  I have lymphdema in my arm, breast and trunk.  I also have pain in my wrist, near my thumb.  Sometimes it radiates up my arm to my elbow, which feels hot, and into my shoulder.  My new PT therapist says it is not lymphedema causing the pain.  She thinks it is neuropathy from the surgeries, chemo (Taxol) and radiation.  I am on Tomoxifen too (for 6 weeks so far).  She said it may or may not go away and is going to get me a splint to wear over the sleeve she is getting me.  Maybe a Physical therapist could help you! Tina
Posts.Title: new day new problem everyminute bkc

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2009 01:38PM TJW wrote: Hi debbisong, I too had extensive radiation to my left side-9 positive nodes.  I just finished on Jan 2.  I am still struggling with extreme fatigue and shortness of breath, along with lymphedema in my breast, trunk and arm.  My radiation oncologist said it was possible to hit a portion of my lung or heart due to the extensive fields radiated.  He said they did everything they could to avoid these organs.  He claims the shortness of breath isn't due to radiation.  My cardiologist says it is probably due to radiation.  I had some of it prior to radiation, so I don't know.  I am in poor physical shape-being basically a chair potato for the last 10 months hasn't helped.  I am working on regaining my strength gradually.  I plan to ask my oncologist about the shortness of breath on the 21st, unless it gets worse.  Hope this helps some.  Tina
Posts.Title: 2 or 3 questions? debisongbird pip57

Posts.Content: Nov 22, 2008 04:28PM TJW wrote: I am in the November Rads group as well.  I finished 8 rounds of dose dense AC+T on August 26.  I had to have a reexcision of my lumpectomy in September and am finally doing the rads.  So far, they are not going so great.  I have completed 9 of 34 treatments to the breast, mammary nodes, clavical nodes and axillary nodes.  I found the tattoos very painful (total of 9).  From day 1, I experienced extreme fatigue, swelling and redness in my breast.  The technicians said I should not have fatigue yet.  I also have a cold and begin coughing every time I lie flat on the table for treatment.  I keep asking if they are sure they are radiating the right areas due to the cough.  I saw the doc twice this week because of the swelling and am now on antibiotics because they think I have infection due to the swelling.  The Doc said he is hoping to ward off cellulitis.  Needless to say, I am finally succumbing to depression.  I have things I really need to do and all I want to is sleep.  Many friends have told me rads would be a cakewalk.  So far, that has not been the case.  I'll keep praying and looking to the day before New Years when this part of TX ends.  (of course, if the infection does not clear up they said they would stop until it does) I may just take the Doc up on the offer of an anti-depressant, although I have really wanted to avoid any more meds.
Posts.Title: November 2008 Rads Group HensonChi Ivy

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2012 11:22PM TJW wrote: Glad to discover all of the information in this thread.  I have not posted in a while, but continue my daily struggles with lymphedema in my left arm, breast and trunk.  I have new issues which concern me.  Of course, by coming here I see they are familiar to others.  I have been experiencing a pins and needles sensation in my axilla and upper back for a year now.  It progressed to a pain in the axilla region if I move the wrong way (sometimes when I am driving).  It's like something has caught.  I have relayed the info to anyone that will listen (oncologist, surgeon etc)  I was sent to see my LE OT.  He worked some of the fluid out of my upper back and it helped somewhat.  He said he did not think it was lympedema, possibly nerve damage or scar tissue.  My oncologist has offered lyrica, but otherwise just seems not concerned.   Now, I am having trouble tolerating compression garments.  The bras end up making my shoulder hurt to the point I can't sleep.  The sleeve hurts my elbow.  A new sensation has started in the muscle of my upper arm.  It will tingle, then my forefinger and thumb go numb.  It seems from reading these posts that it could be RIBP.  The question is where do I get help?  I do not want more meds....the femara is enough of a struggle.  I have found swimming helps tremendously.  On a side note: Had to give up my shallow water aerobics because I have tendonosis in my ankle (I suspect due to the meds I have taken for LE related infection)  Surgeon wants to do surgery, but I think I am going to seek a second opinion there.  Right ankle and left upper body....I have accepted my new normal.  I am just determined to make the best of it.  Nothing annoys me more than when my oncologist (actually the NP-I never ses him) look at me and say "Well, you look great"  Glad I know where to find people that have answers, and understand. Tina
Posts.Title: radiation-induced brachial plexopathy Erica35 ryder51

Posts.Content: TJW wrote: I'm wondering if I have both neuropathy (not sure if I am using the right term) as well as LE.  My breast, upperback, underarm and upperarm are very noticably swollen and painful.  My breast cancer surgeon #2 diagnosed it as breast LE.  However, I also numbness under my arm and in the upper part of my arm.  I have started having pain in my shoulder.  Last night it woke me several times-pain from elbow down into my hand.  My lower arm and hand are not swollen.  I also has some kind of muscle spasms in my chest last night.  Has anyone else experienced this following rads?  I just finished 34 tx on Friday.  I asked the rad oncologist about the numbness and he said I probably had nerves cut from my surgery in April.  He said they should regenerate.  Any advice on this?  How do I follow through so I can find out what is going on with the arm?  I am planning on 10 days at the LE clinic as soon as my skin heals.  I also really need a bra that fits.  Do I just wait for the LE therapist to measure and order for me, or can I measure myself and find something to use until I can go for therapy?  Sorry to have so many questions-but I am so glad I have found all of the experts here.  Otherwise I would really be lost and confused. Tina Dx 3/31/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 2, 9/14 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Neuropathy and LE? TJW sisterinspirit

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2009 07:16PM TJW wrote: Hope you get good news Monday.  Lots of prayers, Tina
Posts.Title: New Symptom lionessdoe TJW

Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2012 10:37PM TJW wrote: Thanks KS1.  I will seek out a physiatrist.  I have the same questions as you regarding how to manage bandaging/compression without aggravating neuropathy.  The swelling in my arm is not really bad, but arm compression really hurts my elbow-it is always swollen and tender.  My biggest problems with swelling are in my breast and upper left trunk, especially under my arm and in my back.  I really need the compression bras to keep it under control.  But, they really seem to exacerbate the shoulder pain.  I'll keep checking back to see if you get any good info.  Tina
Posts.Title: radiation-induced brachial plexopathy Erica35 ryder51

Posts.Content: TJW wrote: Today I went to the first session for my LE-breast, truncal and arm.  The therapist wrapped my arm and hand, but not breast or trunk because they were out of the correct bandages. She hoped they will be in by the end of this week.  My arm is now very uncomfortable.  My elbow and shoulder hurt.  My arm was not really swollen, but I did have some pain.  My major problem is my breast and axilla.  They are still hurting and very swollen.  I also have pain in my ribs. I am numb under my arm as well.  I asked the therapist if my pains are all from LE and she said we will only know after she completes therapy.  Does this sound right?  Should my arm hurt more wrapped than before?  I'd really like to take this off tonight.  I doubt I will go tomorrow because we may actually get snow tonight (rare in SC) and school has already been cancelled.  We don't drive in the snow around here.  Any help or advice is greatly appreciated. Watching for the snowflakes, Tina Dx 3/31/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 2, 9/14 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: First visit to LE Clinic-Help please TJW kira

Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2009 09:27PM TJW wrote: Thanks Binney! I will try to tolerate the wrap knowing things will get better.  My therapist did do some massage on the opposite side from my LE.  She said this would be necessary for a few days to open up the lymph channels.  She also instructed me to find an under armour t-shirt to wear so she could wrap around it for my chest area until a bra is ordered.  I'm limited as to my choice of therapists within less than 1 hour drive time.  I'm hoping she'll get it right.  Thanks for all of your help.  You are a blessing. Still looking for the snow! Tina
Posts.Title: First visit to LE Clinic-Help please TJW kira

Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2009 11:35AM TJW wrote: Tom, Thank you so much for helping me.  I did take my wraps off because they were so uncomfortable and I decided I really needed some sleep.  I will pass on the information to my therapist.  I will seek out someone to help with the pain as well.  If you feel comfortable with a recommendation or sending me contact info in case I can't find an acceptable treatment, please send me a private message.  Thanks again, I can't tell you how helpful your info is. Binney, you are a blessing.  Tina
Posts.Title: First visit to LE Clinic-Help please TJW kira

Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2009 10:04PM TJW wrote: I'm not a stage I, but stage III.  I was diagnosed at 46-and had mammos every year after 40.  If I had waited until 50, it would have been too late for me.  This is ludicrous.  How many deaths will it cause-one is too many, especially when it could have been prevented.  We have to join this battle.  I'm very afraid this is just the beginning of what the future holds when healthcare is controlled by the government.  Call your congressman.
